divs: Sighting DetailsI was driving home and pulled up to my street. I have a nice sky view to the left and noticed how clear a night it was. Saw a very, very bright star. I assumed it was a star but knew it was too low and bright. This was at around 7:45 PM Eastern Standard Time. I went into my house and grabbed a pair of binoculars. Told my wife and she too thought it was bright for a star. Binoculars were not that powerful but I could see it was a continuous bright white light with a touch of red on the bottom. It was a contant brightness, nothing like a star or plane light. I came back out about 40 minutes later and I noticed it moved, not far at all but enough to prove it was not a stationary object. Then I watched many planes fly by the object. It certainly was no plane, star, meteor(although last night there was a meteor shower)At that point I continued to watch and called my brother since I knew he would have a good view where he lives, about 3 miles from me. We both watched it for about an hour and it definately drifted farther into the sky but still incredibly bright. We watched many airplanes fly by it. I drove to his house and watched it as much as I could incase it disappeared. Watched it together from his rear yard which is much higher area than my house. We had an incredible view. At about 10:00 PM we decided to drive to a local store and purchase a telescope with hopes of getting a close up view. We didn't want to leave. As we drove towards the store area, we noticed it disappeared around 10:30. Unfortunately, we were obstructed and did not see how it left but it was gone. I was crushed when we looked up and it was gone! From the time I first noticed it moved and it couldn't be a star I was amazed. I knew it was something out of the ordinary and was so upset we did not get a telescope in time. Plese let me know if others reported this. I know for sure that many planes in the area that night flew by. Those pilots had a great view.
Summary: Very low star, not twinkling, moved slowly over a period of a few hours.
